speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: SCENE II. A room in the castle.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Enter OTHELLO and EMILIA

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: You have seen nothing then?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Nor ever heard, nor ever did suspect.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Yes, you have seen Cassio and she together.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: But then I saw no harm, and then I heard

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Each syllable that breath made up between them.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What, did they never whisper?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Never, my lord.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Nor send you out o' the way?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Never.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To fetch her fan, her gloves, her mask, nor nothing?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Never, my lord.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That's strange.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: I durst, my lord, to wager she is honest,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Lay down my soul at stake: if you think other,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Remove your thought; it doth abuse your bosom.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: If any wretch have put this in your head,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Let heaven requite it with the serpent's curse!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: For, if she be not honest, chaste, and true,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: There's no man happy; the purest of their wives

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Is foul as slander.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Bid her come hither: go.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Exit EMILIA

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: She says enough; yet she's a simple bawd

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That cannot say as much. This is a subtle whore,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: A closet lock and key of villanous secrets

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And yet she'll kneel and pray; I have seen her do't.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Enter DESDEMONA with EMILIA

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: My lord, what is your will?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Pray, chuck, come hither.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: What is your pleasure?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Let me see your eyes;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Look in my face.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: What horrible fancy's this?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: [To EMILIA]  Some of your function, mistress;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Leave procreants alone and shut the door;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Cough, or cry 'hem,' if any body come:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Your mystery, your mystery: nay, dispatch.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Exit EMILIA

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Upon my knees, what doth your speech import?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I understand a fury in your words.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: But not the words.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Why, what art thou?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Your wife, my lord; your true

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And loyal wife.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Come, swear it, damn thyself

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Lest, being like one of heaven, the devils themselves

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Should fear to seize thee: therefore be double damn'd:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Swear thou art honest.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Heaven doth truly know it.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Heaven truly knows that thou art false as hell.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: To whom, my lord? with whom? how am I false?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O Desdemona! away! away! away!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Alas the heavy day! Why do you weep?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Am I the motive of these tears, my lord?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: If haply you my father do suspect

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: An instrument of this your calling back,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Lay not your blame on me: If you have lost him,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Why, I have lost him too.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Had it pleased heaven

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To try me with affliction; had they rain'd

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: All kinds of sores and shames on my bare head.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Steep'd me in poverty to the very lips,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Given to captivity me and my utmost hopes,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I should have found in some place of my soul

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: A drop of patience: but, alas, to make me

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: A fixed figure for the time of scorn

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To point his slow unmoving finger at!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Yet could I bear that too; well, very well:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: But there, where I have garner'd up my heart,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Where either I must live, or bear no life;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The fountain from the which my current runs,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Or else dries up; to be discarded thence!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Or keep it as a cistern for foul toads

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To knot and gender in! Turn thy complexion there,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Patience, thou young and rose-lipp'd cherubin,--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Ay, there, look grim as hell!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I hope my noble lord esteems me honest.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O, ay; as summer flies are in the shambles,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That quicken even with blowing. O thou weed,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Who art so lovely fair and smell'st so sweet

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That the sense aches at thee, would thou hadst

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: ne'er been born!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Alas, what ignorant sin have I committed?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Was this fair paper, this most goodly book,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Made to write 'whore' upon? What committed!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Committed! O thou public commoner!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I should make very forges of my cheeks,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That would to cinders burn up modesty,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Did I but speak thy deeds. What committed!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Heaven stops the nose at it and the moon winks,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The bawdy wind that kisses all it meets

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Is hush'd within the hollow mine of earth,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And will not hear it. What committed!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Impudent strumpet!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: By heaven, you do me wrong.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Are you not a strumpet?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: No, as I am a Christian:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: If to preserve this vessel for my lord

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: From any other foul unlawful touch

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Be not to be a strumpet, I am none.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What, not a whore?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: No, as I shall be saved.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Is't possible?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: O, heaven forgive us!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I cry you mercy, then:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I took you for that cunning whore of Venice

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That married with Othello.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Raising his voice

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: You, mistress,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That have the office opposite to Saint Peter,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And keep the gate of hell!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Re-enter EMILIA

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: You, you, ay, you!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: We have done our course; there's money for your pains:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I pray you, turn the key and keep our counsel.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Alas, what does this gentleman conceive?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: How do you, madam? how do you, my good lady?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: 'Faith, half asleep.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Good madam, what's the matter with my lord?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: With who?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Why, with my lord, madam.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Who is thy lord?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: He that is yours, sweet lady.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I have none: do not talk to me, Emilia;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I cannot weep; nor answer have I none,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: But what should go by water. Prithee, tonight

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Lay on my bed my wedding sheets: remember;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And call thy husband hither.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Here's a change indeed!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: 'Tis meet I should be used so, very meet.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: How have I been behaved, that he might stick

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: The small'st opinion on my least misuse?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Re-enter EMILIA with IAGO

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What is your pleasure, madam?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: How is't with you?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I cannot tell. Those that do teach young babes

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Do it with gentle means and easy tasks:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: He might have chid me so; for, in good faith,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I am a child to chiding.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What's the matter, lady?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Alas, Iago, my lord hath so bewhored her.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Thrown such despite and heavy terms upon her,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: As true hearts cannot bear.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Am I that name, Iago?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What name, fair lady?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Such as she says my lord did say I was.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: He call'd her whore: a beggar in his drink

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Could not have laid such terms upon his callat.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Why did he so?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I do not know; I am sure I am none such.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Do not weep, do not weep. Alas the day!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Hath she forsook so many noble matches,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Her father and her country and her friends,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: To be call'd whore? would it not make one weep?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: It is my wretched fortune.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Beshrew him for't!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: How comes this trick upon him?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Nay, heaven doth know.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: I will be hang'd, if some eternal villain,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Some busy and insinuating rogue,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Some cogging, cozening slave, to get some office,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Have not devised this slander; I'll be hang'd else.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Fie, there is no such man; it is impossible.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: If any such there be, heaven pardon him!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: A halter pardon him! and hell gnaw his bones!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Why should he call her whore? who keeps her company?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: What place? what time? what form? what likelihood?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: The Moor's abused by some most villanous knave,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Some base notorious knave, some scurvy fellow.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: O heaven, that such companions thou'ldst unfold,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: And put in every honest hand a whip

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: To lash the rascals naked through the world

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Even from the east to the west!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Speak within door.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: O, fie upon them! Some such squire he was

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: That turn'd your wit the seamy side without,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: And made you to suspect me with the Moor.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: You are a fool; go to.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: O good Iago,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: What shall I do to win my lord again?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Good friend, go to him; for, by this light of heaven,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I know not how I lost him. Here I kneel:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: If e'er my will did trespass 'gainst his love,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Either in discourse of thought or actual deed,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Or that mine eyes, mine ears, or any sense,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Delighted them in any other form;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Or that I do not yet, and ever did.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And ever will--though he do shake me off

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: To beggarly divorcement--love him dearly,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Comfort forswear me! Unkindness may do much;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And his unkindness may defeat my life,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: But never taint my love. I cannot say 'whore:'

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: It does abhor me now I speak the word;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: To do the act that might the addition earn

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Not the world's mass of vanity could make me.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I pray you, be content; 'tis but his humour:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: The business of the state does him offence,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And he does chide with you.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: If 'twere no other--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: 'Tis but so, I warrant.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Trumpets within

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Hark, how these instruments summon to supper!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: The messengers of Venice stay the meat;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Go in, and weep not; all things shall be well.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Exeunt DESDEMONA and EMILIA

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Enter RODERIGO

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: How now, Roderigo!

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: I do not find that thou dealest justly with me.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What in the contrary?

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Every day thou daffest me with some device, Iago;

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: and rather, as it seems to me now, keepest from me

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: all conveniency than suppliest me with the least

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: advantage of hope. I will indeed no longer endure

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: it, nor am I yet persuaded to put up in peace what

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: already I have foolishly suffered.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Will you hear me, Roderigo?

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: 'Faith, I have heard too much, for your words and

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: performances are no kin together.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: You charge me most unjustly.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: With nought but truth. I have wasted myself out of

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: my means. The jewels you have had from me to

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: deliver to Desdemona would half have corrupted a

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: votarist: you have told me she hath received them

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: and returned me expectations and comforts of sudden

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: respect and acquaintance, but I find none.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Well; go to; very well.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Very well! go to! I cannot go to, man; nor 'tis

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: not very well: nay, I think it is scurvy, and begin

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: to find myself fobbed in it.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Very well.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: I tell you 'tis not very well. I will make myself

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: known to Desdemona: if she will return me my

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: jewels, I will give over my suit and repent my

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: unlawful solicitation; if not, assure yourself I

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: will seek satisfaction of you.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: You have said now.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Ay, and said nothing but what I protest intendment of doing.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Why, now I see there's mettle in thee, and even from

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: this instant to build on thee a better opinion than

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: ever before. Give me thy hand, Roderigo: thou hast

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: taken against me a most just exception; but yet, I

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: protest, I have dealt most directly in thy affair.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: It hath not appeared.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I grant indeed it hath not appeared, and your

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: suspicion is not without wit and judgment. But,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Roderigo, if thou hast that in thee indeed, which I

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: have greater reason to believe now than ever, I mean

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: purpose, courage and valour, this night show it: if

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: thou the next night following enjoy not Desdemona,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: take me from this world with treachery and devise

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: engines for my life.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Well, what is it? is it within reason and compass?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Sir, there is especial commission come from Venice

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: to depute Cassio in Othello's place.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Is that true? why, then Othello and Desdemona

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: return again to Venice.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: O, no; he goes into Mauritania and takes away with

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: him the fair Desdemona, unless his abode be

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: lingered here by some accident: wherein none can be

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: so determinate as the removing of Cassio.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: How do you mean, removing of him?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Why, by making him uncapable of Othello's place;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: knocking out his brains.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: And that you would have me to do?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Ay, if you dare do yourself a profit and a right.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: He sups to-night with a harlotry, and thither will I

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: go to him: he knows not yet of his horrorable

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: fortune. If you will watch his going thence, which

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I will fashion to fall out between twelve and one,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: you may take him at your pleasure: I will be near

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: to second your attempt, and he shall fall between

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: us. Come, stand not amazed at it, but go along with

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: me; I will show you such a necessity in his death

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: that you shall think yourself bound to put it on

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: him. It is now high suppertime, and the night grows

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: to waste: about it.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: I will hear further reason for this.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And you shall be satisfied.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Exeunt
